intro: Prionotes americana, commonly known as the American prionotes, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals. It has palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Prionotes americana is often found in wetlands and along streams, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
